page.title: 14COUNTY HALL WAKEFIELD
page.content: The{County Hall}in Wakefield is the headquaters of the{West Yorkshire} {County Council.}The building was built in 1898. The Council Chamber has four ladies painted on the ceiling representing Learning, Power, Law and Order and Wisdom. West Yorkshire County Council is very important indeed because it decides where rubbish dumps are going to be. They also employ the Police and decide how many firemen are required and how many fire engines are needed. They are also responsible for road safety and the buses. It plans for new roads to be built and old roads to be repaired. In 1986 West Yorkshire County Council is going to be abolished. We do not know what will happen to the services that the County Council are responsible for. JENNY WHELDON AND DEAN PEARSON
